intro: Parainvolucrella scabra, commonly known as the rough parainvolucrella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its morphology includes a slender stem and compound leaves with serrated edges. The species is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
